intro: Nigella oxypetala var. tenuifolia, commonly known as slender Persian flower, is a flowering plant native to the mountains of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, elongated seed pods that split open to release its tiny, black seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique floral structure and delicate appearance.
